title: Sports quiz of the week: Six Nations, stadiums, shootouts and a shutout
description: Have you been watching the football, rugby, snooker, netball, cricket, Formula One, NFL and athletics? Continue reading...
author: Niall McVeigh and Paul Campbell
excerpt: Have you been watching the football, rugby, snooker, netball, cricket, Formula One, NFL and athletics?
text: Marcus Smith, Peres Jepchirchir, and Callum Hudson-Odoi. Composite: Tom Jenkins, GettyMarcus Smith, Peres Jepchirchir, and Callum Hudson-Odoi. Composite: Tom Jenkins, GettyHave you been watching the football, rugby, snooker, netball, cricket, Formula One, NFL and athletics?1.The Six Nations concludes on Saturday. How many teams can still win the title?2.Who was the last English player to miss a penalty in a Champions League shootout before Curtis Jones did it this week?3.Two former snooker world champions went head-to-head in the World Grand Prix final. Who won the match 10-0?4.The revamped Netball Super League begins on Friday night. Which Premier League club’s affiliate side have joined the competition this year?5.Nottingham Forest moved a step closer to a Champions League place by beating Manchester City at the weekend. Who were the reigning European champions the last time Forest played in the European Cup, in 1980-81?6.Manchester United announced plans for a new 100,000-seater stadium this week. Old Trafford has been the club’s home for 115 years, except for a four-year stint where?7.Norman Foster is the architect behind the new stadium at Old Trafford. Which other English ground did he help to design?8.India won the Champions Trophy on Sunday, beating New Zealand by four wickets in the final. How far did the New Zealand team travel during the tournament?9.In women's football, which two teams are playing each other four times in the next 12 days?10.Liverpool face Newcastle United in the League Cup final on Sunday. Which player, who featured for both clubs in his career, scored twice the last time they met in a domestic cup final?11.Newcastle have played in two League Cup finals. They lost both of them to teams from …12.Lewis Hamilton makes his debut for Ferrari this weekend. Who was the last F1 driver to win a championship in a Ferrari?13.Which of this season’s Champions League quarter-finals was the final in a previous year?14.This year's London Marathon is set to make history as the biggest marathon in history. How many people are expected to compete on the day?15.Who has signed a new contract to become the highest-paid non-quarterback in NFL history?Most viewedMost viewed
html:
Have you been watching the football, rugby, snooker, netball, cricket, Formula One, NFL and athletics?
